intro: Ornithoboea feddei, commonly known as the bird's-beak buea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, bird-like seed pods. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces a unique, elongated pod that splits open to release its seeds. Ornithoboea feddei is often found in coastal areas and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
